column5: I am heading out to canal lake tomorrow and was wondering if it is even worth thinking about muskie. I have heard the fishery is not doing to well up there for muskies. Would it be better to focus on the other species? I know muskies are few and far between even under good circumstances but would rather not waste my time completely chasing something that is not there.  Thanks in advance for any advice you can offer Jonaton
Try off of the points & channel edges. Use a Bucktail spinner & leader. Good luck.
might as well give it a shot...and in so doing you will catch other species...pike, lots and lots of pike
